metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0429 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In l2tp_session_delete and related functions of l2tp_core.c, there is possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-152735806

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209
linux-image-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1107.118').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1071.78').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.142').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209').
